Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: 2D flexible layers interwoven by angular BF4- anions

Other Information.Additional Info: The threshold pressure decreases to 0.03 bar at 273 K.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion due to higher energy barrier

Other Information.Additional Info: Significantly higher energy barrier of 2.704 eV compared to ethylene.
The threshold pressure decreases to 0.028 bar at 273 K.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion due to higher energy barrier

Other Information.Additional Info: Significantly higher energy barrier of 5.617 eV compared to propylene.
The threshold pressure decreases to 0.039 bar at 283 K.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion due to higher energy barrier

Other Information.Additional Info: Significantly higher energy barrier of 6.748 eV compared to n-butene.
Benzene can open interlayer spaces due to delocalized π-bonds.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion due to saturated structure

Other Information.Additional Info: Saturated structure of cyclohexane cannot enter the framework.

Sieving Mechanism: Interaction-selective molecular sieving driven by guest-host interactions

Experimental Validation.Method: Breakthrough experiments, gas adsorption isotherms, in-situ FT-IR spectroscopy, and computational simulations
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: IAST selectivity: C2H4/C2H6 = 68.8, C3H6/C3H8 = 108.4, n-C4H8/n-C4H10 = 22.9; Dynamic separation selectivity: C2H4/C2H6 = 9.16, C3H6/C3H8 = 8.76, n-C4H8/n-C4H10 = 3.18

Other Information.Additional Info: Direct production of high-purity (>99.99%) ethylene was achieved from a six-component C2-C4 olefin/paraffin mixture using a two-column configuration with BFFOUR-Cu-dpds and granular porous carbons.
